title: regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper planning and
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development Act
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 

2000 (Exempted Development) (No. 2) Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations shall be included in the collective citation the 

Planning and Development Regulations 2001 to 2023. 

Amendment of Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited planning development act 2000 (exempted development) (no 2) regulation 2023 (2) regulation shall included collective citation planning development regulation 2001 2023 amendment article 5(1) principal regulation

title: regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper planning and
heading: 2. Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the
text_raw:
2. Article 5(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting the 

following definitions after the definition of “business premises”: 

““bus pole”, means a pole, post, or other similar device affixed in a vertical or 
near vertical manner to the surface of a road for the purpose of supporting a bus 
pole sign; 

“bus pole sign” means a sign or panel affixed to a bus pole displaying 
information in relation to a provision of public passenger transport services (as 
defined in the Dublin Transport Authority Act 2008);”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 2nd June, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [269] 3 

Amendment of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Principal Regulations

title: regulations apply would not offend against principles of proper planning and
heading: 3. Schedule 2 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
3. Schedule 2 of the Planning and Development Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 

600 of 2001) is amended, in Part 1, by – 

(a) 

the insertion of the following after Class 30: 

“ 

CLASS 30A 

The carrying out of 
development consisting of the 
removal, construction, erection 
or placing by or on behalf of 
the National Transport 
Authority, a public transport 
operator (as defined in the 
Dublin Transport Authority 
Act 2008) or a local authority 
of: 

- bus poles or bus pole signs in 
connection with a public 
passenger transport service (as 
defined in the Dublin 
Transport Authority Act 
2008). 

The total height above 
ground of bus poles shall not 
exceed 3.6 metres in height. 

” 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 May, 2023. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [269]
